Legal_Issue: Whether the Federal Court of Canada, Trial Division, has jurisdiction to hear a patent infringement case against the Province of Ontario
Decision_Outcome: Action struck out due to lack of jurisdiction
Legal_Rule: Section 5 of the Proceedings Against the Crown Act (Ont.) allows tort actions against the provincial Crown but confines them to Ontario courts
Procedural_Issue: Jurisdiction of the Federal Court over a provincial Crown defendant
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged patent infringement by the Province of Ontario
Decision_Maker: Federal Court of Canada, Trial Division
Review_Standard: Interpretation of statutory authority and jurisdiction
Key_Evidence_Considered: Text of s. 5 of the Proceedings Against the Crown Act (Ont.)
Relevant case law on Crown immunity and federal jurisdiction
Legal_Framework: Statutory framework governing lawsuits against the Crown in Ontario and federal court jurisdiction
Applicant_Challenge: Plaintiffs' attempt to bring patent infringement claim in Federal Court
Court_Result: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction over the claim
Legal_Rule_Source: Proceedings Against the Crown Act (Ont.), s. 5
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied for civil jurisdictional determination)
Defendant_Response: Ontario moved to strike the action for lack of jurisdiction
Remedy_Requested: Adjudication of patent infringement claim in Federal Court
Outcome: Action dismissed; plaintiffs must pursue claim in Ontario courts, if at all
Remedy_Sought: Recognition of jurisdiction and trial on patent infringement
Legal_Provision: Proceedings Against the Crown Act (Ont.), s. 5
Claimant_Status: Private plaintiffs alleging intellectual property rights violation
Legal_Provision_Cited: Proceedings Against the Crown Act (Ont.) s. 5
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of jurisdiction over the defendant (Province of Ontario)
Applicable_Process: Civil litigation procedure in federal court
Jurisdiction: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction; Ontario courts have exclusive jurisdiction under s. 5 of the Ontario Act
Governing_Rule: Proceedings Against the Crown Act (Ont.) s. 5 limits liability actions against the provincial Crown to Ontario courts
